docs.snippet: A Mexican immigrant rights advocate who gained international attention when she took refuge in a Chicago church before being deported asked Tuesday for refuge in the United States on humanitarian grounds....
docs.lead_paragraph: A Mexican immigrant rights advocate who gained international attention when she took refuge in a Chicago church before being deported asked Tuesday for refuge in the United States on humanitarian grounds.

headline.main: Deported Immigrant Activist Asks for Refuge in US
headline.print_headline: Deported Immigrant Activist Asks for Refuge in US

docs.snippet: During a recent meeting of Damascene merchants, talk turned to the case of a colleague detained by Syria's powerful and dreaded state security apparatus....
docs.lead_paragraph: During a recent meeting of Damascene merchants, talk turned to the case of a colleague detained by Syria's powerful and dreaded state security apparatus.

headline.main: Fear Rules in Damascus as Syria's Revolt Enters Fourth Year
headline.print_headline: Fear Rules in Damascus as Syria's Revolt Enters Fourth Year

docs.snippet: Venezuela's Congress on Tuesday requested a criminal investigation of opposition deputy Maria Corina Machado for crimes including treason in relation to her involvement in anti-government protests that have left dozens dead....
docs.lead_paragraph: Venezuela's Congress on Tuesday requested a criminal investigation of opposition deputy Maria Corina Machado for crimes including treason in relation to her involvement in anti-government protests that have left dozens dead.

headline.main: Venezuelan Congress Seeks Probe of Opposition Leader Over Protests
headline.print_headline: Venezuelan Congress Seeks Probe of Opposition Leader Over Protests

docs.snippet: An Egyptian court on Tuesday convicted four police officers in the deaths of 37 detainees, most of them supporters of the ousted Islamist President Mohammed Morsi, who suffocated in a police truck in which they were packed for hours before police ...
docs.lead_paragraph: An Egyptian court on Tuesday convicted four police officers in the deaths of 37 detainees, most of them supporters of the ousted Islamist President Mohammed Morsi, who suffocated in a police truck in which they were packed for hours before police lobbed in tear gas.

headline.main: Egypt Convicts 4 Policemen in Deaths of Islamists
headline.print_headline: Egypt Convicts 4 Policemen in Deaths of Islamists

docs.snippet: Ukraine's leadership simmered with a mix of hopelessness and anger at losing Crimea, tempering an influx of eager young men signing up as reservists with the growing certainty that no savior would deliver them from the Russian takeover....
docs.lead_paragraph: Ukraine's leadership simmered with a mix of hopelessness and anger at losing Crimea, tempering an influx of eager young men signing up as reservists with the growing certainty that no savior would deliver them from the Russian takeover.

headline.main: Ukraine Grapples With Despair in Crimea Takeover
headline.print_headline: Ukraine Grapples With Despair in Crimea Takeover

docs.snippet: An engineering student armed with a slingshot commands a barricade. A biologist with a PhD organizes residents of a rebellious barrio. A retired economist prays for the hooded youths who guard her building....

headline.print_headline: Students and Faculty Man Barricades in Venezuela University City

docs.snippet: Defying Ukrainian protests and Western sanctions, Russian President Vladimir Putin signed a treaty in Moscow on Tuesday making Crimea part of Russia again, but said he did not plan to seize any other regions of Ukraine....
docs.lead_paragraph: Defying Ukrainian protests and Western sanctions, Russian President Vladimir Putin signed a treaty in Moscow on Tuesday making Crimea part of Russia again, but said he did not plan to seize any other regions of Ukraine.

headline.main: Putin Signs Crimea Treaty as Ukraine Serviceman Dies in Attack
headline.print_headline: Putin Signs Crimea Treaty as Ukraine Serviceman Dies in Attack
